concept.title: Running a Pipeline Overview
concept.shortdesc: You can run a pipeline when the pipeline is valid. When you start a pipeline, the reads data from the origin, processes the data, and writes it to the pipeline destinations.

conbody.p: The processes data as it arrives at the point of origin. When no data is available, the waits until new data arrives.

When you stop a pipeline, the completes the processing for the data in the pipeline and notes where it stopped. When you start the pipeline, by default, the continues processing from where it stopped. You can also instruct the to process all available data.
